title: Mona Lisa to be moved as part of major Louvre overhaul
byline: The Mona Lisa will be moved to a new exhibition space at the Louvre in Paris as part of a plan to renovate the world’s most frequented museum.

title: Headline inflation projected to remain negative in near term
byline: Headline inflation, as measured by the year-on-year change in the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI), remained in the negative territory for the fourth consecutive month in December 2024, according to the Central Cank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: CBSL maintains the Overnight Policy Rate at the current level
byline: The Monetary Policy Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, at its meeting held on 28 January 2025, decided to maintain the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) of the Central Bank at its current level of 8.00 per cent.

title: No order to kill it, only to hand over it to goat owner – Mediation Board
byline: In response to reports about a goat-eating dog being killed by hanging, the Justice Ministry said that the Mediation Board did not issue an order to that effect, but facilitated the mutually agreeable solution, which involved handing over the dog to the goat owner after its owner refused responsibility.

title: Geoff Allardice to step down as ICC CEO
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) today confirmed that Geoff Allardice has decided to step down as ICC Chief Executive.

title: “Step up”: President tells private sector
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake delivered a strong message to Sri Lanka’s private sector yesterday, urging them to step up and play their part in uplifting the national economy, rather than leaving the entire burden of transformation on the government.

title: Govt. assures support to uplift apparel industry workforce with vocational training
byline: The government has reaffirmed its support to uplift apparel sector workforce by pledging to collaborate with industry leaders and align vocational training programmes with evolving needs.

title: Cabinet approval granted to sign MoU with Italy to boost bilateral ties
byline:
Cabinet approval has been granted to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and Italy on the establishment of a political consultancy mechanism, Cabinet Spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday.
The Minister said the MoU was signed between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employments and Tourism of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Corporation of the Republic of Italy.

title: Namal Rajapaksa indicted before High Court over alleged Krrish deal
byline: The Attorney General has filed indictments against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP)  Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa over the alleged misappropriation of Rs.70 million belonging to Krrish Company.

title: MP Ramanathan Archuna arrested
byline: Jaffna District MP Dr. Ramanathan Archuna was arrested in Jaffna over obstructing duties of police office on duty, Police Media Spokesman SSP Buddhika Manatunge said.

title: Govt. will not retain CDS position: Defence Secretary
byline: The government will not retain the position of Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), Defence Secretary Air Vice Marshal (Rtd) Sampath Thuyacontha said.

title: Another illegally assembled jeep found in Ratnapura
byline: Three suspects were arrested along with an illegally assembled Prado-type jeep at Angamman in Ratnapura by the Walana Anti-Vice Squad.

title: Committee submits report on passport issue
byline: The committee appointed to study the passport issue and work out recommendations to resolve it has handed over its report to the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala.

title: Head-on collision between two buses in Habarana injures 16
byline: A head-on collision between a private bus and a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus on the Habarana-Minneriya road left 16 people injured this morning (29).

title: Harsha Ilukpitiya’s bail application fixed for inquiry by Supreme Court
byline: A bail application submitted on behalf of Harsha Ilukpitiya, the former Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, was fixed for inquiry by the Supreme Court today.

title: Schoolboy dies in wasp attack at Pussellawa
byline: A school student died and seven others, including four members of the same family, were injured in a wasp attack in Pussellawa, police reported.

title: Sri Lanka Transport Board Chairman Ramal Siriwardena resigns
byline: Ramal Siriwardena has resigned from his position as Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation said.

title: Trump offers millions of federal workers eight months pay to resign
byline: President Donald Trump has offered buyout packages to almost all federal workers who do not want to return to the office, a major move designed to shrink the US government.

title: Air Marshal Bandu Edirisinghe assumes duties as Sri Lanka Air Force Commander
byline: Air Marshal Bandu Edirisinghe officially assumed duties today as the 20th Commander of the Sri Lanka Air Force.

title: Experts warn against harmful effects of skin whitening creams
byline: The use of skin whitening creams is widespread in Sri Lanka, but experts warn that bleaching creams may contain harmful ingredients that can cause serious health issues.

title: Automated system to block mobile phones without TRC approval
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) said it will introduce new software to detect and prevent the use of mobile phones that do not have TRC approval.

title: Indian fishermen arrested in SL waters, remanded
byline: Thirteen Indian fishermen, who were arrested by the Sri Lanka Navy yesterday (28) for illegally entering Sri Lankan waters off Kankesanthurai, were remanded until February 10 by the Mallakam Magistrate today.

title: Trump asks Musk to ‘go get’ NASA astronauts stuck in space
byline: In a post on X on Tuesday evening, Elon Musk said President Trump had asked his rocket company SpaceX to bring home “as soon as possible” two NASA astronauts who have been on the International Space Station since June.

title: Opposition parties united against Govt over lack of slots in parliamentary bodies
byline: The political parties representing Parliament will unite in a joint effort to challenge the ruling National Peoples Power (NPP),accusing it of undermining parliamentary tradition by failing to allocate an adequate number of slots to them in committees.

title: Western Province Governor denies knowledge on container clearance
byline: Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof today denied any knowledge of the 323 containers which were said to have been cleared from the Colombo port without subjecting them to inspection.

title: 323 containers did not belong to WP Governor Hanif Yusoof: SL Customs
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs today denied allegations that the recently released 323 containers belonged to Expolanka Holdings Limited, which is headed by Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof.

title: Police constable arrested for drunk driving in Ratmalana
byline: A police constable attached to the Mount Lavinia Police Station was arrested for causing an accident under the influence of liquor, police said.

title: Will not force farmers to sell paddy to government: Namal Karunaratne
byline: Claiming that the government will not force the farmers to sell paddy to the government, Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Livestock Namal Karunarathne requested the farmers to provide some amount of paddy to the government at the minimum guaranteed price.

title: Come with us to meet farmers and  see their frustration: Opposition MP
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Kavinda Jayawardene invited Deputy Minister of Agriculture Namal Karunaratne to accompany them to go and meet farmers and see their frustration.

title: MP Archchuna Ramanathan arrested
byline: Jaffna District MP Dr. Ramanathan Archuna was arrested in Jaffna over obstructing duties of police officers, Police Media spokesman SSP Buddhika Manatunge said.
